intro: Chiococca sessilifolia, commonly known as the sessile-leaved chiococca, is a climbing plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsules that release small, hairy seeds when mature. Chiococca sessilifolia is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
